title: Exclusive photos: 'American Gods'
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Exclusive photos: 'American Gods' Mr. Wednesday (Ian McShane) and Shadow Moon (Ricky Whittle) make an unlikely teamup in Starz's 'American Gods,' an adaptation of the Neil Gaiman fantasy novel. A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Exclusive photos: 'American Gods' None Mr. Wednesday (Ian McShane) and Shadow Moon (Ricky Whittle) make an unlikely teamup in Starz's 'American Gods,' an adaptation of the Neil Gaiman fantasy novel. James Dimmock, Starz Entertainment Shadow Moon (Ricky Whittle) is introduced to all manners of weirdness in Starz's 'American Gods.' Starz Entertainment Jonathan Tucker is Low Key Lyesmith, a young prison sage who's in jail with Shadow. Starz Entertainment None Yetide Badaki co-stars as the love goddess Bilquis, whose bedroom proclivities might strike some as odd. Jan Thijs, Starz Entertainment, LLC None Easter (Kristin Chenoweth) is wooed by Mr. Wednesday (Ian McShane). Jan Thijs, Â© 2017 Starz Entertainment, LLC None Mr. Wednesday (Ian McShane) has a gift for Zorya Vechernyaya (Cloris Leachman), a relative of the Slavic god of darkness. Jan Thijs, Starz Entertainment, LLC None Vulcan (center, Corbin Bernsen) is the god of guns who meets Mr. Wednesday (Ian McShane) and Shadow Moon (Ricky Whittle). Beth Rinehart None Shadow Moon (Ricky Whittle) and his wife Laura (Emily Browning), whose death helps lead Shadow to go on an interesting journey. Jan Thijs, Starz Entertainment, LLC None Bruce Langley plays The Technical Boy, a New God personification of the Internet. Jan Thijs, Starz Entertainment, LLC None Crispin Glover plays the enigmatic New God known as Mr. World. Starz Entertainment Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
